result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz, August 10, 2015 sentencing hearing

Defendant Richard W Kaszuba in court, in custody with attorney David Karpe.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF232, 14CF307, 14CF411, 14CF134, 14CF119, and 13CF406.  Rights/Elements.  In 14CF411 defendant pled no contest to Cts.1 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  On Ct. 1 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 years in the prison system.  2 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Payment of restitution $2056.35 plus surcharge.  On Ct. 3 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to Ct. 1.  $443.00 costs.  Ct. 2 dismissed but read in.  330 days of jail credit due.  In 13CF406 defendant pled guilty to Ct. 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1,2, & 4 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 3 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to 14CF411.  $443.00 costs.  174 days jail credit.  In 14CF119 defendant pled guilty to Ct. 1, and no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered. Ct. 1 $443.00 costs.  on Ct. 3 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years, consecutive to 14CF411.  Submit DNA sample.  Ct. 3 Cts. $518.00.  394 days of jail credit.   In 14CF134 defendant plead guilty to Ct. 1 and no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered. On Ct. 1 $443.00 costs.  On Ct. 2, Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years, consecutive to 14CF411.  Submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs.  394 days of jail credit.  In 14CF307 defendant pled guilty to Cts. 3 & 8.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Domestic Abuse enhancer on Ct. 3 dismissed.  Cts 1,2,4,5,6,7,9, 10 & 11 dismissed but read in.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to 14CF411.  Ct. 3 $443.00 costs.  Ct. 8 $243.00 costs.  394 days of jail credit.  14CF232 Dismissed but read in.  Any bond on these cases will be applied towards costs.  Defendant is not eligible for challenge incarceration or substance abuse programs in 14CF411.

2:50 pm.  Defendant Richard W Kaszuba in court, in custody.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 13CF406, 14CF119, 14CF134, 14CF232, 14CF307, & 14CF411.  Rights/Elements.  Court advised defendant that public defender office did state they would appoint a new atty to the case.  Court discussed the agreement that was put in writing by the DA's office.   Defendant would like to have an appointed atty. from the Public Defenders office.  Defendant is to contact the Public Defenders office. 3:07
plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.
from DA Kohlwey, requesting a hearing.

Defendant Richard W Kaszuba in custody, by jail video, with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez in the courtroom.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin, requested a denial, as victim not in courtroom. Atty. Gonzalez moved the Court that defendant be granted contact. Court had concerns with contact. Bond modified: if defendant is incarcerated, he may have contact. Defendant made statement regarding contact, stated he will fire Atty. Gonzalez when he is out of jail. Atty. Gonzalez motioned to withdraw. Court asked Atty. Gonzalez to check with public defender office to see if another attorney will be appointed. (Gonzalez is second one appt'd.) Attorney Gonzalez to file Motion to Withdraw after talk with public defender office. Motion denied. Bond continued.
Bail/bond hearing on May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Motion to withdraw as counsel was filed by Atty Haase.  State holds no position.  Court will grant motion for the two files with Br. 2.

Defendant Richard W Kaszuba in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Jane Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 13CF406, 14CF119, 14CF134, 14CF232, 14CF307, & 14CF411.  14CF406 has had a preliminary hearing already and an arraignment. 14CF119, 14CF134, 14CF232, 14CF307, & 14CF411.
